title: Time-series Schema
description: Used to indicate the behavior of time partitioned semantics when composed into data schemas.

@id.title: Identifier
@id.description: A unique identifier for the time-series event.

xdm:timestamp.title: Timestamp
xdm:timestamp.description: The time when an event or observation occurred.

xdm:eventType.title: Event Type
xdm:eventType.description: The primary event type for this time-series record.

meta:enum.advertising.completes: Indicates if a timed media asset was watched to completion - this does not necessarily mean the viewer watched the whole video; viewer could have skipped ahead.
meta:enum.advertising.timePlayed: Describes the amount of time spent by a user on a specific timed media asset.
meta:enum.advertising.federated: Indicates if an experience event was created through data federation (data sharing between customers).
meta:enum.advertising.conversions: A customer pre-defined action(s) which triggers an event for performance evaluation.
meta:enum.advertising.firstQuartiles: A digital video ad has played through 25% of its duration at normal speed.
meta:enum.advertising.impressions: Impression(s) of an advertisement to an end-user with the potential of being viewed.
meta:enum.advertising.midpoints: A digital video ad has played through 50% of its duration at normal speed.
meta:enum.advertising.starts: A digital video ad has started playing.
meta:enum.advertising.thirdQuartiles: A digital video ad has played through 75% of its duration at normal speed.
meta:enum.web.webpagedetails.pageViews: View(s) of a webpage has occurred.
meta:enum.web.webinteraction.linkClicks: Click of a web-link has occurred.
meta:enum.commerce.checkouts: An action during a checkout process of a product list, there can be more than one checkout event if there are multiple steps in a checkout process. If there are multiple steps the event time information and referenced page or experience is used to identify the step individual events represent in order.
meta:enum.commerce.productListAdds: Addition of a product to the product list. Example a product is added to a shopping cart.
meta:enum.commerce.productListOpens: Initializations of a new product list. Example a shopping cart is created.
meta:enum.commerce.productListRemovals: Removal(s) of a product entry from a product list. Example a product is removed from a shopping cart.
meta:enum.commerce.productListReopens: A product list that was no longer accessible(abandoned) has been re-activated by the user. Example via a re-marketing activity.
meta:enum.commerce.productListViews: View(s) of a product-list has occurred.
meta:enum.commerce.productViews: View(s) of a product have occurred.
meta:enum.commerce.purchases: An order has been accepted. Purchase is the only required action in a commerce conversion. Purchase must have a product list referenced.
meta:enum.commerce.saveForLaters: Product list is saved for future use. Example a product wish list.
meta:enum.delivery.feedback: Feedback events for a delivery. Example feedback events for an email delivery.
